content.text:
# Block Structure Analysis

## Analysis of the Main Target Image:

The target structure consists of three layers with a total of 7 blocks:

### Layer 1 (Bottom):
- Three red arch blocks arranged in a U-shape configuration
- Two arch blocks (#1) at the front corners
- One arch block (#3) at the back, with the arch facing sideways

### Layer 2 (Middle):
- Two yellow rectangular blocks (#4) placed horizontally, forming a bridge across the red arch blocks
- One yellow rectangular block (#7) placed perpendicular to connect the two horizontal blocks at the back

### Layer 3 (Top):
- One red arch block (#2) placed on top of the yellow blocks, with its arch facing forward
- One orange triangular roof block (#12) placed on top of the red arch block

## Required Blocks from Dictionary:
- 2× Block #1 (Red arch blocks)
- 1× Block #2 (Red arch block with opening facing forward)
- 1× Block #3 (Red arch block with opening facing sideways)
- 2× Block #4 (Yellow horizontal rectangular block)
- 1× Block #7 (Yellow horizontal rectangular block, slightly longer than #4)
- 1× Block #12 (Orange triangular roof block)

## Assembly Order:
```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 1
   Step3: Move block with index 3
   Step4: Move block with index 4
   Step5: Move block with index 4
   Step6: Move block with index 7
   Step7: Move block with index 2
   Step8: Move block with index 12
}
```

This assembly sequence builds the structure from bottom to top, starting with the red arch blocks as the foundation, then adding the yellow rectangular blocks for the middle layer, and finally placing the red arch block and orange roof piece on top.
